CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 20, 1952, pg. 1 reads: "East Liberty Merchants Paint Windows For Xmas - Businessmen of the 5800 block on Penn Avenue sponsored a competition among the art students of five high schools as they sought to brighten their display windows for the Yule season. Here are the winners....Shown in center photo are the Westinghouse students who formed the two top teams.  They are, left to right; Lois Day, Delores Bowser, H.R. Barnett, Westinghouse High School art teacher; Phyllis Pagnato and Rose Marie Mammolite; whose painting of the Wolfarth Bakery window is shown at the right...-Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Westinghouse High School art contest winners, from left: Lois Day, Delores Bowser, H.R. Barnett, Westinghouse High School art teacher; Phyllis Pagnato and Rose Marie Mammolite, another version
